episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including bizarre proposals for raising the Titanic, a unique case of owl cannibalism, historical insights from the Battle of Agincourt, and the origins of adult coloring books.

facts.fact: Early proposals for raising the Titanic back to the ocean's surface included filling it up with ping pong balls, injecting 180,000 tons of Vaseline into it, and turning the ship itself into an ice rig.
In 1927, an owl was found that had another owl in its stomach, and that owl had a third owl in its stomach.
Almost every Englishman at the Battle of Agincourt ate a small amount of soil just before the battle started.
The first known coloring book was meant for adults.
